text: today I am announcing that in the coming
weeks I will be resigning as a member of
the United States Senate senator Al
Franken of Minnesota is stepping down
after multiple accusations of sexual
misconduct including forcible kissing
and groping in a speech announcing his
resignation Franken called out the
allegations against President Trump
there is some irony in the fact that I
am leaving while a man who has bragged
on tape about his history of sexual
assault sits in the Oval Office and a
man who has repeatedly preyed on young
girls campaigns for the Senate with with
the full support of his party Franken
was known for his left-leaning politics
for decades but he wasn't elected to
public office until 2008 before that he
was best known as a performer and writer
on Saturday Night Live I'm good enough
I'm smart enough and doggone it people
like me his humor books include this one
about Rush Limbaugh and lies and the
lying Liars who tell them which prompted
a lawsuit from Fox News he won his
Senate seat by a razor thin margin of
312 votes it was close he was sometimes
outspoken in 2009 he wouldn't allow
fellow Senator Joe Lieberman to receive
additional time to speak for I'm sorry
the senator is spoken for 10 minutes I
wonder if I could ask unanimous consent
for just an additional moment in my
capacity as senator from Minnesota
I object that move was criticized by
Senator John McCain as a breach of
decorum I'll tell you I've never seen a
member denied an extra minute or so as
as the chair just did after President
Trump was elected Franken sparred with
his would-be appointees if there is any
evidence that anyone affiliated with the
Trump campaign communicated with the
Russian government your answer under
oath before this committee was that you
quote
did not have communications with the
Russians Attorney General Jeff sessions
later recused himself from the Russia
investigation my reply to the question
of senator Franken was honest and
correct as I understood it at the time
Franken still denies some of the
allegations against him others I
remember very differently after the
first accusations against Franken became
public he apologized and welcomed an
ethics investigation I know that I've
led a lot of people down but as other
woman came forward accusing Franken of
making improper advances high-ranking
Democrats like Senators Chuck Schumer
and Kirsten Gillibrand asked them to
step down you need to draw a line in the
sand and say none of it is okay I hope
that he'll do the right thing and step
aside be the best step for if he stepped
down originally Franken seemed like he
could weather the accusations but the
calls for him to leave the Senate became
too loud
